description:
T1 Tulip tree-  Removing approximately 2.5m from the height leaving the height at 9m. Cut back from building to give a 2.5m clearance.
T2 Robinia-  Removing approximately 2.5m from the height leaving the height at 9m. Cut back from building to give a 2.5m clearance.
T3 Robinia-  Removing approximately 2.5m from the height leaving the height at 9m. Cut back from building to give a 3m clearance.
These trees are close to the building and restricting light into the properties.

Lime tree (T4, T5 & T6) - Repollard back to previous pollarded points removing approximately 2 metres of growth. As is good practice on Lime trees. Tree height 6 metres, crown spread 3 metres, maximum cut diameter 10cm.
Lime tree (T7, T8 & T9-) - Repollard back to previous pollarded points removing approximately 2 metres of growth. As is good practice on Lime trees. Tree height 2.5 metres. maximum cut diameter 10cm.
